channel.title: Trainings and Consultations on Przemek Malirz
channel.description: Recent content in Trainings and Consultations on Przemek Malirz

item.title: Non-relational Oracle
item.description: JSON in Oracle I am sure this may seem like an obvious feature for some of you, especially those who have worked with schema-less stores. However, it is often overlooked by programmers who choose or stick with RDBMS stores. This is the audience I would like to dedicate this short write-up to. Don’t get me wrong. I have nothing against relational databases. In fact, I have been working with them (particularly with Oracle) since I can remember, and this post only promotes them more.

item.title: Unlocking the Power of InnerSource: Key Strategies You Can't Ignore
item.description: I know that I should start with the definition of InnerSource. However, I just couldn’t resist to give you some concrete material to read earlier. If you, like me, have been searching for ways to enhance collaboration among teams within your organization, or if you’re a CxO seeking to cultivate your company’s culture, elevate the quality of your products, and simultaneously reduce costs, then you should read this blog post.

item.title: About me
item.description: Bio My name is Przemek Malirz. I am an architect and a programmer with a background in designing and implementing various-sized systems. I have gained expertise across several industries such as surveying, graphics, telecommunications, insurance, and financial services. My goal is to create a practical and secure architecture that facilitates project development and maintenance while minimizing incidents. As a technical leader, I also manage distributed and multicultural teams. I participate in all stages of the project development cycle - from cost estimation and business analysis to design, full-stack programming, testing, deployment, and production maintenance.
